nodes.documentation:
This is a generic lootbox contract that can be used to mint or sendrandom tokens. The configuration
of the contract is detailed in MyLootBox.sol
nodes.name: ILootBox

nodes.documentation: Returns the name of this factory.
nodes.name: name

nodes.documentation: Returns the symbol for this factory.
nodes.name: symbol

nodes.documentation: Number of options the factory supports.
nodes.name: numOptions

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns whether the option ID can be minted. Can return false if the developer wishes to
restrict a total supply per option ID (or overall).
nodes.name: canMint

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns a URL specifying some metadata about the option. This metadata can be of the
same structure as the ERC1155 metadata.
nodes.name: uri

nodes.documentation: Indicates that this is a factory contract. Ideally would use EIP 165 supportsInterface()
nodes.name: supportsFactoryInterface

nodes.documentation: Indicates the Wyvern schema name for assets in this lootbox, e.g. "ERC1155"
nodes.name: factorySchemaName
open

nodes.documentation:
@dev If the tokens for some class are pre-minted and owned by the
contract owner, they can be used for a given class by setting them here
nodes.name: setClassForTokenId

nodes.documentation:
@dev Remove all token ids for a given class, causing it to fall back to
creating/minting into the nft address
nodes.name: resetClass

nodes.documentation:
@dev Withdraw lootbox revenue
Only accessible by contract owner
nodes.name: withdraw

of the contract is detailed in MyLootBox.sol

attributes.documentation: Returns the name of this factory.
attributes.name: name

attributes.documentation: Returns the symbol for this factory.

attributes.documentation: Number of options the factory supports.
attributes.name: numOptions

@dev Returns whether the option ID can be minted. Can return false if the developer wishes to

canMint(uint256,uint256).details: Returns whether the option ID can be minted. Can return false if the developer wishes to restrict a total supply per option ID (or overall).

open(uint256,address,uint256).details: Mints or sends asset(s) in accordance to a specific address with a particular "option". This should be callable only by the contract owner or the owner's Wyvern Proxy (later universal login will solve this). Options should also be delineated 0 - (numOptions() - 1) for convenient indexing.

params._amount: amount of the option to mint
params._toAddress: address of the future owner of the asset(s)

resetClass(uint256).details: Remove all token ids for a given class, causing it to fall back to creating/minting into the nft address

setClassForTokenId(uint256,uint256).details: If the tokens for some class are pre-minted and owned by the contract owner, they can be used for a given class by setting them here

uri(uint256).details: Returns a URL specifying some metadata about the option. This metadata can be of the same structure as the ERC1155 metadata.

withdraw().details: Withdraw lootbox revenue Only accessible by contract owner

factorySchemaName().notice: Indicates the Wyvern schema name for assets in this lootbox, e.g. "ERC1155"

name().notice: Returns the name of this factory.

numOptions().notice: Number of options the factory supports.

supportsFactoryInterface().notice: Indicates that this is a factory contract. Ideally would use EIP 165 supportsInterface()

symbol().notice: Returns the symbol for this factory.

userdoc.notice: This is a generic lootbox contract that can be used to mint or sendrandom tokens. The configuration of the contract is detailed in MyLootBox.sol
